page.title: 16Farming (2)
page.content: Mr. Bell is a parent of one of the pupils at school. He is the Area NFU Secretary and he volunteered to tell the class about farming in the area. Farming is still traditionally a family concern in this area. There is a large proportion of owner occupied farms which are usually passed on from father to son. Education, science and technology have made a tremendous impact on farming during the last 20-30 years. Improved machinery, chemicals and biological factors all play a very important role in modern farming techniques. Mr. Bell is confronted with all types of problems in his work and he feels that there are still pressures in farming that others do not appreciate. EEC policies, animal related problems, high capital investment worry today's farmers, though many enjoy their work.
